intro: Neobartlettia lobulata, commonly known as the narrow-leafed barlettia, is a flowering plant native to the southeastern United States. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its narrow, lance-shaped leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, sandy soils along streambanks and in wetlands. It blooms in late spring to early summer, producing vibrant pink to purple flowers that attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Neobartlettia lobulata is a perennial herb that thrives in wetland habitats and is often found in swampy areas with partial to full sunlight.
